cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then forecast to accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near/just south of Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Indian Pass FL, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Tampa Bay as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida Gulf Coast from Charlotte Harbor through Tampa Bay northward to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely by Tuesday night; hurricane-force winds possible Wednesday morning if the core tracks close enough to Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts up to 12 inches possible; risk of flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, life-threatening rip currents, and a few tornadoes in outer rainbands could disrupt port operations.
